basics.name: Royce Cornwell
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software engineer with a background in Electrical Engineering, currently pursuing an M.Sc. in Computer Science at the International University of Applied Sciences in Berlin (graduating Q3 2026). Proficient in Python, JavaScript, HTML5, and POSIX C, with experience in web development and a machine learning-based project. Skilled in team collaboration, bringing ideas that streamline development, as seen in my Lost and Found web app project. Passionate about problem-solving and the software engineering process, including documentation and iterative development. Seeking software engineering roles in Germany to grow and contribute to impactful projects.

work.summary: Tutored for math subjects such as Calculus, Algebra
highlights: Held group studies from calculus level math courses
Tutored in other subjects such as intro to programming

work.summary: From the Akamai Workforce Initiative, worked at the Kec Observatory as an electrical engineer intern
highlights: Reviewed existing designs & creating plans for integrating hardware
Implemented with Ladder Logic programming (RSLogix500 programming environment)
Presented project in a technical STEM format

volunteer.summary: Tutored kids at the community center with homework and learning Japanese
highlights: Created a study plan for beginner Japanese learning

awards.title: JASSO Scholarship
awards.summary: The Japan Student Services Organization (JASSO) offers scholarships for qualified international students who are accepted by a Japanese university. I was accepted for one semester as an exchange student and awarded for my academic standings.

awards.title: Alakaina Scholarship
awards.awarder: University of Hawaii at Kauai Community College
awards.summary: Before transferring to a 4-year institution, I was awarded with the Alakaina foundation  for a written essay about their passion for engineering and alongside their GPA of 3.5 and above.
